column1: 1^Dīxit Dominus Dominō meō: Sedē a dextrīs meīs, dōnec pōnam inimīcōs tuōs scabellum pedum tuōrum.^The Lord said to my Lord: Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thy enemies thy footstool.
2^Virgam virtūtis tuae ēmittet Dominus ex Sion
column2: domināre in mediō inimīcōrum tuōrum.^The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion
column3: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.

column1: 3^Tēcum principium in diē virtūtis tuae, in splendōribus sanctōrum
column2: ex uterō ante lūciferum genuī tē.^With thee is the principality in the day of thy strength, in the brightness of the saints
column3: from the womb before the day star I begot thee.

column1: 4^Jūrāvit Dominus et nōn poenitēbit eum: Tū es sacerdōs in aeternum secundum ōrdinem Melchisedech.^The Lord hath sworn and shall not repent: Thou art a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedech.

column2: confrēgit in diē īrae suae rēgēs.^The Lord is at thy right hand
column3: he hath broken kings in the day of his wrath.

column2: conquassābit capita in terrā multōrum.^He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins
column3: he shall crush the heads in the land of many.

column2: proptereā exaltābit caput.^He shall drink of the torrent in the way
column3: therefore shall he lift up the head.
